wikipedia_page.main: Jonathan Samuel (28 February 1853 – 22 February 1917) was a British manufacturer and Liberal Party politician.

response: Wales was noted for its "radical Liberal-Labour" politics, and the rhetoric of these politicians clearly won favour with the urban population of the North East. Penry Williams and Jonathan Samuel won the seats of Middlesbrough and Stockton-on-Tees for the Liberal Party and Penry's brother, Aneurin would also win the newly created Consett seat in 1918.

link_mentions.page: List of MPs elected in the 1895 United Kingdom general election
List of MPs elected in the January 1910 United Kingdom general election

response: The by-election was caused by the death of the sitting Liberal MP, Jonathan Samuel on 22 February 1917.
